details.content: It will be a good budget. It will be for the benefit of the common people: Shiv Pratap Shukla, MoS, Finance to ANI.

details.title: Tight security outside Finance Ministry ahead of the Budget
details.content:
#Visuals from outside Finance Minister Arun Jaitley's residence in Delhi. He will be presenting the Union Budget 2018-19 in the Parliament today. pic.twitter.com/RwRPcTkIHr

— ANI (@ANI) February 1, 2018
Finance Minister Arun Jaitley arrives at the Ministry of Finance.

Delhi: Union Budget papers arrive in Parliament #UnionBudget2018 pic.twitter.com/s0UmiIMl0Q

— ANI (@ANI) February 1, 2018
Sensex opens at 36,127.20, Nifty at 11,067.25.

Delhi: Union Budget papers arrive in Parliament #UnionBudget2018 pic.twitter.com/Ba80vBoWDy

— ANI (@ANI) February 1, 2018
Finance Minister Arun Jaitley met President Ram Nath Kovind at Rashtrapati Bhavan before presenting the Union Budget 2018-19 in the Parliament.
Finance Minister Arun Jaitley arrives at the Parliament to present the Union Budget 2018.
Cabinet meeting begins inside Parliament ahead of Union Budget 2018.

Delhi: Copies of #UnionBudget2018 being checked by security inside Parliament premises pic.twitter.com/Mvk0FqWYzo

— ANI (@ANI) February 1, 2018

Earlier, Jaitley, carrying the symbolic cherry-brown briefcase containing the Budget, was seen at the Ministry of Finance (North Block) along with Finance Secretary Dr Hasmukh Adhia, CEA Arvind Subramanian, Economic Affairs Secretary Subhash Chandra Garg.
The Finance Minister is also expected to address the media at around 3.30 pm this afternoon.
PM Narendra Modi and Union Ministers Sushma Swaraj and Ram Vilas Paswan arrive at the Parliament.
Finance Minister Arun Jaitley starts presenting the Budget.
Indian economy has performed very well since our government took over in May 2014. It is now the seventh largest in the world, says Arun Jaitley.
Demonetisation has reduced the circulation of black money and has boosted digital transactions: Jaitley
"We consider agriculture as an enterprise and we will focus on increasing the on-farm and non-farm income of farmers."
"Exports to grow by 17 per cent in 2017-18."
"India is today a USD 2.5 trillion economy and will become fifth largest economy in the world from the present seventh largest."
"Introduction of GST has made indirect tax system simpler."
"Government focusing on ease of living now."
"Rs 1400 crore allotted for food processing."
"Agri-Market Development Fund with a corpus of 2000 crore to be set up for developing agricultural markets."
"42 mega food parks to be set up. Government to set MSP at one-and-half times the cost of production for Kharif crops."
"Rs 10,000 crore for fisheries and Animal Husbandry corpus fund."
"A favourable taxation treatment to help farmer producer organisations."
"Punjab, Haryana, Delhi and NCR to reduce air pollution by in-seeking management of crop residue."
"Kisan credit card to be extended to fisheries, animal husbandry farmers."
"PM Modi has articulated the vision of minimum government, maximum governance."
"8 crore free gas connections for women under Ujwala scheme."
"Proposed to raise institutional credit for agriculture to Rs 11 Lakh Crore for 2018-19."
"Rs 16,000 crore allocated to Pradhan Mantri Saubhagya Yojana."
"Rs 14.3 lakh crore to be spent to improve rural livelihood."

Govt plans to construct 2 crore more toilets under Swachh Bharat Mission: Arun Jaitley #UnionBudget2018 pic.twitter.com/I5KpfLUpVT

— ANI (@ANI) February 1, 2018
"Government to initiate integrated B Ed programs for teachers."
"Government to set up Eklavya schools for tribal children."
"Government to launch 'Revitalising Infrastructure and Systems' in Education by 2022 with Rs 1 Lakh crore."
"World's largest health care program to be implemented."
"10 crore poor families to get Rs 5 Lakh insurance cover each."
"24 new government medical colleges to be set up. The aim is to have one medical college for every three parliamentary constituencies."
"Rs 1200 crore allotted for health and wellness centres. Government to initiate two major schemes as part of Ayushman Bharat program."
"The National health protection scheme will benefit 50 crore people."
"187 projects approved for infrastructure and river surface cleaning."
"115 districts to be identified for development work in health, infrastructure etc. THese districts will be role models of development."
"Government to set up two new full-fledged Schools of Planning and Architecture."
"Rs 600 crore allocated for nutritional support to all Tuberculosis patients."
"Government to set up PM Research Fellow Scheme, for which 1000 B Tech students are to be selected."
"Technology will be the biggest driver in improving quality of education. We propose to increase the digital intensity in education and move gradually from blackboard to digital board."
"Direct Benefit Transfer is a global success story."
"India produced over 275 million tonnes of food grains and 300 million tonnes of fruits and vegetables in 2016-17."
"Crop production is at record high. The government is committed to giving 50 per cent more than cost of crop production to farmers."
"Government to contribute 12 per cent of wages of new employees to Employee Provident fund for three years."
"Rs 7148 crore allocated for textile sector."
"Rs 2.04 lakh crore allocated to smart cities mission under which 99 cities will be developed."
"Women’s contribution towards Provident fund reduced to 8 percent in the first three years for new PF accounts."
"Target for loan disbursement under Mudra scheme set at Rs 3 lakh crore for next fiscal."
"Government to soon announce scheme to address the issue of Non-Performing Assets."
"Rs 50 lakh crore needed for infrastructure building."

details.title: All railway stations and trains to have wi-fi facilities

details.content: "Rs 11,000 crore allocated for Mumbai rail network, Rs 17,000 crore for Bengaluru Metro network."
"Construction of a tunnel under the Se-La pass in Arunachal Pradesh proposed."
"10 cities will be developed into iconic tourist destinations."
"UDAN scheme to connect 56 unserved airports and 31 unserved helipads."
"Over Rs 1.48 lakh crore to be allocated for railways in next fiscal."
"In addition to wi-fi, all trains will soon have CCTV surveillance for increased security."
"150 km additional suburban railway network all over country at the cost of Rs 40,000 crore proposed."
"Airport capacity to be raised to handle 1 billion trips per year."
"12,000 wagons, 5160 coaches and 700 locomotives being procured."
"AMRUT program to focus on water supply to all households in 500 cities. Water supply contracts for 494 projects worth 19,428 core awarded."
"Escalators to be built at stations which have footfall of over 25,000."
"An institute is coming up in Vadodara to train the manpower required for the high speed railway projects."
"5 lakh wi-fi spots to be set up for the benefit of 5 crore rural Indians."
"SEBI may consider mandating large corporates to use bond market to finance one-fourth of their fund needs."
"Rs 5.97 lakh crore allocated for infrastructure spending in India."
"The Disinvestment target for 2018-19 is Rs 80,000 crore."

details.title: We will take all steps to eliminate the use of Cryptocurrencies
details.content: "We will encourage Blockchain technology in payment systems."
"Salary of President raised to Rs 5 lakh per month, Vice President Rs 4 lakh, governors Rs 3.5 lakh."
"Law to be introduced to fix salaries of Members of Parliament every 5 years indexed to inflation."
"Government will assign every enterprise in India a unique ID on the lines of Aadhaar."
"Government insurance companies to be merged into a single entity, and subsequently listed in the stock exchange, as part of the disinvestment programme."
"24 Public Sector Units to be divested including Air India."
"NITI Aayog to establish a national programme for artificial intelligence."
"Excess revenue collected from personal income tax amounts to Rs 90,000 crore."
"Effective tax payers in India now 8.27 crore."
"Projected fiscal deficit for 2018-19 is 3.3 per cent of GDP."
"Gold monetisation scheme being revamped so that people can open gold deposit accounts in a hassle-free manner."
"Corporate Tax for companies with turnover of up to Rs 250 crore cut to 25 per cent."
"No change in personal income tax structure."

details.title: Standard deduction of Rs 40,000 in lieu of existing reimbursement of medical expenses and transport allowance.

details.content: "Standard deduction will benefit 2.5 crore people, including pensioners."
"﻿For senior citizens, exemption of interest income on bank and post office savings deposits raised to Rs 50,000﻿."
"Rs 50,000 additional benefit to senior citizens for investment in mediclaim."
"Now, senior citizens can invest up to Rs 15 lakh in interest-bearing LIC schemes. It has been doubled from Rs 7.5 lakh."
"Short-term capital gains tax continues at 15 per cent."

details.title: Mobile phones to get costlier as excise duty raised from 15 per cent to 20 per cent.

details.content: "Education cess, which is levied on individual and corporate income, increased to 4 per cent from 3 per cent to collect additional Rs 11,000 crore."
"Cash payments exceeding Rs 10,000 by trusts and institutions will be disallowed in a bid to curb cash economy."
"Tax on distributed income of equity oriented mutual funds announced at the rate of 10 per cent."
Union Finance Minister Arun Jaitley concludes his budget speech.
Sensex at 35,526.23, down by 438.79 points from morning trade.

The govt has attempted to pay lip service to farmers and to other marginalised sections of society but it is a classical case of too less and completely at the inappropriate time: Manish Tewari, Congress #UnionBudget2018 pic.twitter.com/npQLkF2oHn

— ANI (@ANI) February 1, 2018

details.title: CPI (M) leader Sitaram Yechury calls budget 'unconnected to ground reality'.
details.content:
Modi govt's last full budget is a textbook exercise in post-truth: Unconnected to ground realities. #UnionBudget

— Sitaram Yechury (@SitaramYechury) February 1, 2018

Promise of increasing Farmers' incomes remains unfulfilled. The input costs conveniently ignore the rising costs of petroleum/diesel

— Sitaram Yechury (@SitaramYechury) February 1, 2018

details.title: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis hails budget.
details.content:
Yet another history created by Modi Government!
World’s largest healthcare initiative!
National Health Protection Scheme:
50 crore people would get free health care benefits upto ₹5 lakh per family. #Budget2018 #NewIndiaBudget @arunjaitley @narendramodi

— Devendra Fadnavis (@Dev_Fadnavis) February 1, 2018

details.title: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan reacts to the budget.
details.content:
Kudos to PM @narendramodi & FM @arunjaitley for presenting a visionary and futuristic budget which will provide an impetus to creation of a #NewIndia. It touches the chord of each and every section of society - farmers, salaried taxpayers, senior citizens & the poor. #Budget2018

— ShivrajSingh Chouhan (@ChouhanShivraj) February 1, 2018

details.title: Hell hath no fury like a nation scorned: Congress leader Manish Tiwari
details.content:
After servicing the Capitalist, oligarch and Khas Aadmi for four years suddenly Govt feels that it can fool the Farmer, the labourer, the small artisan, the salaried professional that it cares about them too in an election year.Hell hath no fury like a nation scorned.#budget2018

— Manish Tewari (@ManishTewari) February 1, 2018

details.title: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar
details.content: "A national health protection scheme to benefit 10 crore poor families announced, it is a huge initiative. I would like to congratulate the government."
I congratulate the Finance Minister for the decision regarding Minimum Support Price. I am sure it will help the farmers tremendously: PM Modi
"This budget will accelerate economic growth, it is focused on all sectors," says PM Modi.

details.title: Union minister Nitin Gadkari
details.content: "Medical insurance of Rs 5 lakh for 10 crore families is a huge initiative. This is a historic budget."

details.title: BJP Chief Amit Shah reacts
details.content:
This budget gives new wings to the aspirations of the poor, farmers and the middle class. The #NewIndiaBudget will truly empower all sections of the society to attain prosperity.

— Amit Shah (@AmitShah) February 1, 2018

details.title: Former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda
details.content: "The Finance Minister has tried to make improvements for farmers but the problems of farmers and rural people are enormous. Measures may not be sufficient."
PM Modi says farmers, Dalits, tribal communities will gain from the budget, which will create new opportunities for rural India.

details.title: Railway minister Piyush Goyal reacts
details.content:
Congratulations to PM @NarendraModi & FM @ArunJaitley on rolling out #NewIndiaBudget 2018 which has covered a comprehensive array of schemes aimed at 'Sabka Saath Sabka Vikas'. The budget will enhance people's Ease of Living and give impetus to build New Railways for a New India.

— Piyush Goyal (@PiyushGoyal) February 1, 2018

details.title: Union Home Minister Rajnath Singh
details.content: "It's a grand budget, lot of announcements for the poor, farmers and tribals. This budget will also cement India as a global economic power."

details.title: Sitaram Yechury slams increase of education, health cess
details.content:
Abandoning state responsibilities towards health & education, this govt burdens people mercilessly by hiking cess now. #UnionBudget

— Sitaram Yechury (@SitaramYechury) February 1, 2018

details.title: Nitin Gadkari praises budget
details.content:
FM Shri @arunjaitley has laid out an excellent budget for the benefit of masses. This is a Pro poor, Pro people budget.
Universal health insurance to cover over 40% of India's population is a step first of its kind in history.#NewIndiaBudget

— Nitin Gadkari (@nitin_gadkari) February 1, 2018

details.title: Union Minister MJ Akbar
details.content: "In the 1 hour 45 minute speech, 1 hour was for the poor, this is indeed historic. The opposition has become too pessimistic."

details.title: Samajwadi Party leader Akhilesh Yadav calls budget a disastrous one.
details.content:
"Disappointment to poor farmers and labourers; Frustration to unemployed youth; Slap on the mouths of businesses, women, goodwill and ordinary people. It is a disastrous government budget that ignores the troubles of the public. The BJP showed that it is only a processionary to the rich. Now the public will respond."

गरीब-किसान-मजदूर को निराशा; बेरोजगार युवाओं को हताशा; कारोबारियों, महिलाओं, नौकरीपेशा और आम लोगों के मुँह पर तमाचा. ये जनता की परेशानियों की अनदेखी करने वाली अहंकारी सरकार का विनाशकारी बजट है. आख़री बजट में भी भाजपा ने दिखा दिया कि वो केवल अमीरों की हिमायती है. अब जनता जवाब देगी.

— Akhilesh Yadav (@yadavakhilesh) February 1, 2018

details.title: Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Tejashwi Yadav calls increase of MSP for farmers a sham.
details.content:
"The budget is quirk with the farmers. The minimum support price for wheat is Rs 1600 per Quintals but no wheat will be bought at that price in the market. The farmer will be forced to sell wheat for Rs 1300. What is the point of giving the MSP multiplied one and a half times? Do not decide the fate of farmers sitting in air-conditioned rooms."

बजट किसानों के साथ छलावा है। गेहूं का न्यूनतम समर्थन मूल्य 1600रू प्रति क्विंटल है लेकिन बाज़ार मे उस मूल्य पर कोई गेहूँ ख़रीदने वाला नहीं है।मजबूरन किसान को 1300 मे गेहूँ बेचना पड़ता है।किसका डेढ़ गुणा MSP देने की बात है? वातानुकूलित कैबिनों में बैठकर किसानों का भाग्य मत लिखिए।

— Tejashwi Yadav (@yadavtejashwi) February 1, 2018

details.title: Union Minister Smriti Irani
details.content: "I want to congratulate Prime Minister Narendra Modi on announcing the world's biggest national health protection scheme. This budget is for the development of the poor, senior citizens and women, for farmers and increasing their income."

details.title: Congress MP Ahmed Patel reacts
details.content:
Would have preferred if instead of MP's getting a salary raise, the salaried middle class would have got income tax relief

— Ahmed Patel (@ahmedpatel) February 1, 2018

details.title: Congress leader Randeep S Surjewala calls budget as 'jumlanomics'
details.content:
#Budget2018
Modinomics + Jaiitleynomics = Jumlanomics

न सोच,ना रास्ता,
न विज़न, ना क्रियान्वन ।

हमेशा बातों से काम,
पर काम की बात नहीं !

सही कहा-
नाम बड़े और दर्शन छोटे !

— Randeep S Surjewala (@rssurjewala) February 1, 2018

details.title: Union Minister Ananth Kumar Hegde
details.content: "It's a transformational budget, and it will bring about a positive change in everyone's lives. It's a budget for the common man, the farmers and for the nation."

किसानों को छला जा रहा है। जवाब दो!

किसानों का क़र्ज़ा माफ़ क्यों नहीं किया?
कृषकों की आय को 2022 तक दुगुना कैसे किया जाएगा? इसका रोड मैप क्या है?
सिर्फ़ हवाई बातों और मुँह ज़ुबानी ख़र्च से आय दुगुनी हो जायेगी क्या?
किसानों की आत्महत्या क्यों नहीं रूक रही?

— Lalu Prasad Yadav (@laluprasadrjd) February 1, 2018

details.title: MoS Jitendra Singh
details.content: "Keeping focus on 'ease of living' the budget has kept people of all segments in mind."

details.title: Congress leader Tehseen Poonawalla
details.content:
50%MSP to farmers. This means elections between April and October . #Budget2018

— Tehseen Poonawalla (@tehseenp) February 1, 2018

details.title: Not a populist budget as such: Shehzad Poonawalla
details.content:
Raising the tax slab to ₹3lakhs would have been better than the standard deduction of ₹40000 - must admit that despite elections approaching #Budget2018 hasn't been tailored as a populist budget per se https://t.co/V8aXKzVtoI

— Shehzad Jai Hind (@Shehzad_Ind) February 1, 2018

details.title: Congress leader Sanjay Jha
details.content:
The middle-class has been led up the garden path by Modi Ji for the last 4 years. Use and throw model. #Budget2018

— Sanjay Jha (@JhaSanjay) February 1, 2018

details.title: Aam Aadmi Party leader and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal
details.content:
I had expected some financial assistance to important infrastructure projects for national capital. Am disappointed that Centre continues its step-motherly treatment to Delhi

— Arvind Kejriwal (@ArvindKejriwal) February 1, 2018

details.title: Congress leader Priyanka Chaturvedi
details.content:
Union Budget explained
The suited booted ------
The middle class ------
The bottom of the pyramid------

— Priyanka Chaturvedi (@priyankac19) February 1, 2018

details.title: AAP leader Manish Sisodia echoes Delhi CM Kejriwal
details.content:
Disappointing #Budget2018.
Not a single extra rupee increased in Delhi’s share in Central taxes since 2001-02, stays at Rs 325 Cr. No other part of India gets such treatment.

BJP govt at Center continues to treat Delhi residents as second-grade citizens. N/1

— Manish Sisodia (@msisodia) February 1, 2018
